definition[0]: if a vehicle or a wheel on a vehicle skids, it suddenly slides sideways and you cannot control it
example[0]: The car skidded as she turned onto the highway.
example[1]: The bus skidded off the road and into a ditch.
definition[1]: a sudden sliding movement of a vehicle that you cannot control
example[2]: Turn the car towards the skid if you lose control of it.
example[3]: He slammed on the brakes and we went into a long skid (=started to skid).
definition[2]: a period of time during which a person or team is not successful â€“ used in news reports
example[4]: The Red Sox victory ended a six-game skid.
definition[3]: a flat narrow part that is under some aircraft such as helicopters, and is used in addition to wheels for landing
definition[4]: a piece of wood that is put under a heavy object to lift or move it
